shared_text:
Saint Peter Public Schools added 27 new photos.
September 10 at 4:28 PM ·

B Day students in grades K-12 had in-person classes today (Thursday) for the first time during 2020-21 school year. Even though it was bit cool for this time of year, that didn't hamper the excitement on the faces of students and staff alike. Here are some photo highlights from the (second) first day of school!

Saint Peter Public School students in grades K-12, who are A Day students, kicked off the the new school year today (Wednesday), while B Day students will start tomorrow (Thursday). Here are some photo highlights from each of the four main buildings (South Elementary, North Elementary, Saint Peter Middle School, and Saint Peter High School) with more photos to come tomorrow! Enjoy!

post_text:
Friends of Learning's annual Back to School program got some valuable assistance from members of the Saint Peter varsity football team in filling backpacks with school supplies for students of need in the St. Peter area. This is the third year in a row the Saints players have helped out with Friends of Learning's program.

This backpack filling effort took place at Johnson Hall (Nicollet County Fairgrounds) late Tuesday afternoon. Here is a photo of some of the Saints football players who helped out! (Thanks to Michelle Zehnder Fischer for sharing the photo.) MSHSL

Friends of Learning is a collaboration between Nicollet County Health and Human Services, St. Peter Lions Club, St. Peter Kiwanis, Friends of the St. Peter Library, and the Salvation Army. The group is committed to helping families in St. Peter and rural Nicollet County obtain necessary school supplies.

For more information on Friends of Learning's Back to School project please go to https://www.stpeterschools.org/about/district-programs/friends-of-learning

post_text: FUELING UP FOR BACK TO SCHOOL WORKSHOP! Saint Peter Public Schools teachers and staff began Back to School Workshop in preparation for the 2020-21 school year. Today's activities began early this morning as the District 508 administration team and some School Board members served a Drive-By Breakfast of donuts/rolls, coffee, juice, and/or water to staff members! Here are some photos of the grab-&-go service the admin team and board members provided along Lincoln Drive near the District Office/Saint Peter Middle School building.

post_text: LEGION'S SCHOOL SUPPLY DRIVE & SLOPPY JOE FEED: The St. Peter American Legion Post 37 is sponsoring a Drive By School Supply Drive and Sloppy Joe Feed tomorrow (Saturday, Aug. 22) from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. School supply donations (cash or supplies) and a free will donation for the meal will be accepted. All proceeds will be given to the Friends of Learning program. This important program provides backpacks and supplies to Saint Peter Public School students in need.

post_text: NEW TEACHERS FOR 2020-21: District 508 is hosting its annual New Teacher Workshop today (Wednesday) and tomorrow. Shown here are eight of the nine new teachers coming on board this fall. They include: front row (l to r), Jen St. John (MS Special Education), Sara Knobe (HS English), Maggie Carlson (HS Counselor); middle row, Rachel Ryan (MS 7th & 8th Grade ELA), Kyle Krause (K-4 STEM NORTH & SOUTH), Sam Stoelk (North 4th Grade); back row, Alex Rivers (MS FACS), and Emmelie Pinz (MS ELA). Not pictured is Lindsey Brace (Early Childhood Special Education).

post_text:
PARAPROFESSIONALS NEEDED FOR 2020-21: Saint Peter Public Schools has several paraprofessional job openings for the 2020-2021 School Year.

Positions are open in the following schools:

Saint Peter Early Childhood Center
South Elementary
North Elementary
Saint Peter Middle School
Saint Peter High School
Hoffmann Learning Center

These positions consist of 3.5 to 6.75 hours per student contact day and the starting rate of pay is $13.00 or $13.30 per hour.

To apply go to www.stpeterschools.org and click on "About"
and then click on "Employment." From there click on "View Open Positions" and then click on "Support Staff."

post_text:
2020 SPHS PROM CHALLENGE VIDEO - This past spring, after the traditional SPHS Prom was postponed, Prom Committee advisors Amanda Rodning and Jodi Nixon got creative by putting together a Prom Challenge for the students. SPHS seniors and juniors were asked to submit prom-related pictures/videos/Tik Toks for the chance to win a prize. Here is the compilation video from the challenge --> https://youtu.be/8OP_9iYdQ-U

The original prize was $25 in St. Peter Chamber Bucks, but the prize list was expanded, according to Amanda, because the students were having so much fun with it and more than 30 prizes were eventually given away from area businesses/organizations.

Because of today's storm, not all of the Summer Read & Feed meal bags were distributed and there will be a second chance pick up of the remaining bags tomorrow (Thursday) from 9 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. at all three pick-up locations (Middle School, North Elementary, and South Elementary).

See accompanying photo for the contents for this week's meal bag, the final one being distributed for the Summer Read & Feed program. If you have any questions please email SPPS Food Service Director Emily Craig at emily.craig@aviands.com.

post_text:
FALL ACTIVITIES REGISTRATION: Just a reminder that online registration is now open for fall sports at Saint Peter Schools. You can register for those activities at the following link --> http://www.bit.ly/STPActivitiesRegistration

Practices start Monday, Aug. 17 for girls tennis, boys and girls cross country, boys and girls soccer, and girls swimming & diving and the registration process must be completed before a student can begin to participate in practice sessions.

The Activities Office stresses that all new students and incoming 7th graders need to turn in a physical to the Activities Office (SPHS room A102) before they can practice

Middle School football and volleyball will not start until on or around September 2nd at the moment. This is subject to change and will be communicated out to families.

For more detailed information on SPHS/MS fall activities please see the following link --> https://www.stpeterschools.org/news-and-notes/arts-activities-news

post_text:
BOOSTER CLUB GOLF TOURNEY: A reminder that the St. Peter Booster Club is sponsoring its 4th annual golf fundraiser at Shoreland Country Club this Saturday (Aug. 15) with registration starting at 10:30 a.m. and a shotgun start at noon. The social hour and dinner begins at 5:30 p.m.

All proceeds from this four-person scramble event will go towards supporting Saint Peter Saints athletic programs. Come out, have some fun and support our Saints athletic teams and student-athletes. The event will be held rain or shine and there is still room for more teams to play!

For more information on the tourney and how to register and/or become a hole sponsor please see the attached flyer or go to the Booster Club website at www.stpeterboosterclub.org. If you have further questions please contact Bob Southworth at bsouthworth@htbmn.com.

FALL SPORTS UPDATE: The SPHS Activities Office posted this update, earlier this afternoon, from MN State High School League regarding fall sports:

Changes for this fall:

Sports with a reduced season starting 8/17:
- Cross Country (girls & boys)
- Girls Tennis
- Swimming/Diving
- Soccer (girls & boys)

Sports moved to spring between winter and traditional spring sports:
- Volleyball
- Football

Specifics on practices and middle school activities will come out shortly.

More details on the specific seasons will eventually be posted on MSHSL website (www.mshsl.org).

post_text:
FRIENDS OF LEARNING DONATIONS NEEDED: Friends of Learning fills backpacks with school supplies for kids in need in Nicollet County and the group is in need of monetary donations this year. Donations can be mailed to the Friends of Learning at P.O. Box 156, St. Peter or through VENMO at @FOLBackpack.

Friends of Learning is a collaboration between Nicollet County Health and Human Services, St. Peter Lions Club, St. Peter Kiwanis, Friends of the St. Peter Library, and the Salvation Army. The group is committed to helping families in St. Peter and rural Nicollet County obtain necessary school supplies.

Check them out on the school website at https://www.stpeterschools.org/about/district-programs/friends-of-learning or on Facebook at @FOLBackpack.

All proceeds from this four-person scramble event will go towards supporting Saint Peter Saints athletic programs. Come out, have some fun and support our Saints athletic teams and student-athletes. The event will be held rain or shine.

For more information on the tourney and how to register and/or become a hole sponsor please see the attached flyer or go to the Booster Club website at www.stpeterboosterclub.org. If you have further questions please contact Bob Southworth at bsouthworth@htbmn.com.

post_text:
FOAM SOAP DISPENSERS NEEDED: St. Peter Public Schools is looking for donations of used/empty foam soap dispensers. Our suppliers have been able to get us foam hand sanitizer refills containers but the supply of dispensers is scarce.

If you have any extra dispensers and are able to donate them, we will have blue receptacles at two entrances to the St. Peter Middle School at Door A (on the Capitol Drive cul-de-sac) and Door V (upper entrance off of Broadway Avenue).

We are only looking for the foaming dispensers, not those that would dispense gel. These dispensers will be used in classrooms and other learning spaces in all of our district buildings. Your donations would be greatly appreciated.

FREE FOOD DISTRIBUTION EVENT: The Nicollet County (COVID Food Assistance Program) Free Food Distribution event is set for today (Thursday, July 16) from 3 to 5 p.m, or until food runs out, at Saint Peter High School's west parking lot. Those participating should enter on the roundabout off Broadway Avenue.

This event is put on each time by the St. Peter Food Access Network and Second Harvest Heartland and is open to all households in need. For more information, please see the accompanying flyer.

SPHS COSTA RICA TRIP: Just a reminder that a 10-day trip to Costa Rica at the end of June 2021 for students studying Spanish at Saint Peter High School is available! More information, including the trip schedule, is available at:
https://www.xperitas.org/language-immersion-programs/destinations/costa-rica/aventuras-ticas

Sign up before July 15 of this year for an early bird discount! The trip cost is approx. $3000. If you have other questions please contact SPHS Spanish teacher Dan "Profe" Englehorn at denglehorn@stpeterschools.org or 507-934-4212, Ext. 6149.

post_text:
HABITAT FOR HUMANITY HOUSE UPDATE: The Habitat for Humanity house that Building Trades students from Saint Peter High School built this year was moved Tuesday morning from its original location on the south side of SPHS to its new and permanent location in the Traverse Green Subdivision. A crew from Otting House Movers of Lakeville was in charge of moving the house.

SPHS Building Trades students, under the direction of Warren Peterson (and previously Tom Applen) have about a 25-year working relationship building houses for Habitat for Humanity of South Central MN. Here are some photos of the house being moved off the SPHS site this morning.

To see a video and more photos of the house being moved into its new location please see the Habitat for Humanity of South Central MN's Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/hfh.southcentralmn

post_text: THANK YOU DR. OLSON!!! Today is the last official day for Dr. Jeff Olson as Saint Peter Public Schools' interim superintendent. We would like thank Dr. Olson for his leadership and guidance during an eventful and memorable 2019-20 school year. District 508 students, staff, families and community members are so fortunate and grateful for his service these past 12 months. Best of luck to you and Judy as you enter the next chapter of your lives!

post_text:
SUMMER READING OPPORTUNITIES: Want to make sure your kids keep reading over the summer? Be sure to check out these free ebook options! eLibraryMN, which provides free access to ebooks for MN residents year round, has partnered with the Virtual Library Comic Convention and many different comic book publishers to make a huge variety of comic books available online for free throughout the summer. Check the following links out!

* VLCC Press Release (information about the VLCC partnership) -- https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/multiple-state-library-organizations-launch-virtual-comic-davis

* VLCC Comic Book Collections (all the comic books available to MN residents curated by publisher) -- https://mn-comics.biblioboard.com/modules

* VLCC Comic Book Overview (a sampling of the first issue/volume of many of the comic book series available) -- https://mn-comics.biblioboard.com/home

* eLibraryMN--All books (links to ALL of the books available on eLibraryMN curated by age level) -- https://elibrarymn.org/ebooks

post_text:
BULLDOG HOCKEY GOLF TOURNEY: The Minnesota River Bulldog Hockey parents will host the 29th annual MN River Bulldog High School Open Golf Tournament and Dinner on Monday, July 13, at Shoreland Country Club in St. Peter. All proceeds will be divided equally between the MN River Bulldogs' girls and boys high school teams.

Please click on the following link for more information on the tourney and dinner as well as the registration forms. https://bulldoghockey.pucksystems2.com/page/show/29452-minnesota-river-bulldog-high-school-hockey

The registration deadline is set for Wednesday, July 1, so organizers have time to plan.

In addition to playing in the tourney, other ways to support this event includes:

* Sponsoring a hole and/or golf
* Come for the great dinner even if you can't golf (cost $25)
* Helping out on the day of the tourney
* Sharing the website's tourney info with a business which may be interested in sponsoring a hole.

post_text:
SPHS SUMMER ACTIVITIES: Summer activities for some Saint Peter High School student-athletes started up on a limited basis on Monday. The Saints summer strength and conditioning program began early morning sessions on the practice fields just to the north of SPHS gym, while Saints' boys basketball coach Sean Keating started his Skills Academy in the gym. Here are some photo highlights from earlier today.

The SPHS girls basketball program opens summer activities later today at the SPHS with the Saints varsity football program hosting weekly team meetings starting tomorrow (Tuesday). These programs are being operated using proper social distancing guidelines.

Other SPHS varsity sports programs may be starting up limited activities later this month and information on those activities will be shared by the Activities Office as it becomes available. An update will be coming out soon today (Monday) on the 7th & 8th grade strength and conditioning program, so keep an eye out for that!

post_text: SECOND CHANCE FOR MEAL BAGS: The SPPS Kitchen Staff has approximately 200 meal bags left over from today with around 800 being distributed, according to SPPS Food Service Director Emily Craig. The staff will have a second chance pick-up tomorrow (Thursday, June 11) for the 5-day meals bags at North Elementary, South Elementary, and Saint Peter Middle School from 9 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. while supplies last. Staff at those sites will also have individual meals available for those who do not participate in the 5-day meal bag.

post_text:
HABITAT HOUSE VOLUNTEERS: Some Saint Peter High School students and staff recently volunteered their time to help with some of the foundation work at the site where the new Habitat for Humanity house will be moved. SPHS building trades instructor Warren Peterson led the group of volunteers which include staff member Amanda Rodning and sophomores Bennett Olson, Teddy Pierret, and David Zhang. Here are some photos of the group in action. Thanks to Mrs. Rodning for sharing the pictures!

The SPHS building trades class normally builds a house each year for the local Habitat for Humanity chapter, but students weren't able to complete the work as planned due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Work on the house will be completed by Habitat for Humanity volunteers.

FINAL GOLDEN TICKET WINNERS: The last four winners of the Golden Ticket program, sponsored by the Saint Peter Schools Kitchen Staff through its meal distribution program, were recently announced by Emily Craig, Saint Peter Schools Food Service Director. Only 4 of the last 8 winning tickets were turned in by the deadline so the prize for each of those winners was doubled to a $50 gift certificate. The final winners (pictured here) include the following:

* Kroix and Hadlee Bjorklund
* Jack Rolfin
* Ashton Guida
* Sophia Schaefer

Thank you so much to all for participating and, just a reminder that the Modified Summer Read and Feed program gets underway on Wednesday, June 10th. For more information on that program please click on the following link --> https://www.stpeterschools.org/about/flu-prevention/continuity-of-nutrition

post_text: SPHS SENIOR PARADE - A dedicated group of SPHS senior parents organized a reverse parade for the Class of 2020 along Nicollet Avenue Thursday evening. The seniors parked their vehicles on both sides of the road and then family, friends, and other community members drove by in support of the new graduates! It was a well attended and well organized event and provided the senior class with memories they won't soon forget! Here are some photo highlights of the senior class's reverse parade! #SaintsStrong #CongratsSPHSSeniors (Correction...please note the fireworks are tonight (Friday) in Kasota for seniors and their families.)

MEAL BAGS UPDATE: SPPS staff are distributing 9-day meal bags today (Thursday) for the end of the school year. Tables are open from 11 a.m to 12:30 p.m. today at all three locations (South, North & MS) as well as afternoon bus routes at normal scheduled time.

According to Emily Craig, SPPS Food Service Director, as of 10:30 a.m. this morning, there were about 500 meal bags left at Saint Peter Middle School stop, 170 left at South Elementary and 200 left at North Elementary. She added, "We are hoping to give out all 1,402 meal bags today!"

Attached is a copy of the flyer which lists what is contained in the 9-day meal bag as well as a photo of the staff at the Middle School ready to distribute food earlier today.

The Modified Summer Read and Feed program begins on Wednesday, June 10th. For more information on that program click on the following link --> https://www.stpeterschools.org/about/flu-prevention/continuity-of-nutrition

SPPS HALL OF FAME UPDATE - The Saint Peter Public Schools' Hall of Fame induction luncheon, originally scheduled for Friday, July 3, has been postponed to Saturday, Oct. 3, due to the COVID-19 pandemic situation.

The Hall of Fame induction luncheon is scheduled to start at 11:30 a.m. on Saturday, Oct. 3, at the Saint Peter High School Commons. More information on the luncheon will be released as it becomes available.

Please note, applications are no longer being accepted for this year’s class of inductees. The newest members of the SPPS Hall of Fame will be selected during a committee meeting on Wednesday, July 15 and candidates will be notified starting on Friday, July 17.

The Hall of Fame induction luncheon is scheduled to start at 11:30 a.m. on Saturday, Oct. 3, at the Saint Peter High School Commons. More information on the luncheon will be released as it becomes available.

Please note, applications are no longer being accepted for this year’s class of inductees. The newest members of the SPPS Hall of Fame will be selected during a committee meeting on Wednesday, July 15 and candidates will be notified starting on Friday, July 17.

NOTICE: All District 508 facilities, both indoor and outdoor, are closed to organized activities through Friday, June 12. This policy is consistent with the other member schools of the Big South Conference and other area school districts.

District 508 is awaiting further guidance from the Minnesota Department of Education, Minnesota Department of Health, and the Center for Disease Control (CDC) on when those facilities can be reopened for organized activities. Thank you for your cooperation and stay tuned for further updates!

EARLY CHILDHOOD THANK YOU & INFO: As Early Childhood programs begin to wrap up for the school year we’d like to thank all of our families for sharing their children with us! Watching your children grow and learn has filled our hearts with joy and is the reason we do what we do.

For those who are moving up to kindergarten, please remember to complete a kindergarten registration form. You can find those forms at the following link --> https://www.stpeterschools.org/about/student-enrollment

For those who are looking for a preschool for the 20-21 school year we have openings and would love to have you join us! Please call 507 934-4211 for more information.

post_text:
SCHOLARSHIP FUNDRAISER UPDATE: SPHS alum and current St. Peter resident Charlie Potts is running 50 kilometers this Saturday (May 23)to raise money to create #RunStPeter scholarships for Saint Peter High School graduates! Please consider helping these awesome students by donating at the following GoFundMe page for Charlie's run --> http://gf.me/u/xz75rv

Charlie has well exceeded his goal of raising $500 to fund two small scholarships for SPHS students.

"We're over $1,700 in donations now (between GoFundMe, random cash donations, and pledges)," Charlie said. "I'm going to leave the GoFundMe open through the weekend."

Charlie has 14 applications for the scholarship so far, and welcomes more to apply. SPHS seniors can apply by filling out the application at https://bit.ly/2WLirwU

His plan is to work with SPHS Counselor Jana Sykora and other school staff on selecting the scholarship winners some time next week and he hopes to deliver checks to the recipients sometime on or around June 1st.

GOFUNDME.COM
#RunStPeter Scholarship organized by Charlie Potts

post_text:
SUMMER SCHOOL AGE CARE - Saint Peter Public Schools will provide Summer School Age Care from 7:45 a.m. to 5:45 p.m. on Mondays through Fridays from June 4 to August 14. This will be for kids in completed grades K-5 and be held at North Elementary School.

Applications are available at South & North Elementary Offices or by calling Community & Family Education at (507) 934-3048, ext. 2.

Top priority will be given to children of emergency care workers until May 26th with the #2 priority being families in need of FULL TIME care (4-5 days/week).

Registration fee is $32 and some of the highlights of the Summer School Age Care program is will maintain a social distancing ratio of 1 adult for every 9 students in a classroom and include many age-appropriate activities. See attached flyer for more details!
text:
SUMMER SCHOOL AGE CARE - Saint Peter Public Schools will provide Summer School Age Care from 7:45 a.m. to 5:45 p.m. on Mondays through Fridays from June 4 to August 14. This will be for kids in completed grades K-5 and be held at North Elementary School.

Applications are available at South & North Elementary Offices or by calling Community & Family Education at (507) 934-3048, ext. 2.

Top priority will be given to children of emergency care workers until May 26th with the #2 priority being families in need of FULL TIME care (4-5 days/week).

Registration fee is $32 and some of the highlights of the Summer School Age Care program is will maintain a social distancing ratio of 1 adult for every 9 students in a classroom and include many age-appropriate activities. See attached flyer for more details!

SCHOLASTIC SUMMER READ-A-PALOOZA VIRTUAL BOOK FAIR - Because many schools had their book fairs canceled this spring, Scholastic is offering a virtual book fair this summer. South Elementary, North Elementary, and Saint Peter Middle School will all be taking advantage of the Summer Read-a-Palooza Virtual Book Fair.

The fair will remain open all through the summer, so families can purchase books through the fair until September 4. Here are some more details:

SCHOLASTIC SUMMER READ-A-PALOOZA
VIRTUAL BOOK FAIR
Shopping is super easy!

* Go to your school's Virtual Book Fair link
* Login or create an account if you haven't shopped at Scholastic before
* Choose some awesome books
* Pay with a credit card
* Wait for your awesome books to be delivered to your home!

All purchases benefit the SPPS libraries!
Contact Karen Snay (ksnay@stpeterschools.org) with questions.

South link: https://bit.ly/SouthVirtualBookFair
North link: https://bit.ly/NorthVirtualBookFair
MS link: http://bit.ly/SPMSBookFair2020

post_text:
SPHS VIRTUAL SPRING SHOWCASE! Saint Peter High School's Theater Department is hosting its first-ever Virtual Spring Showcase tonight (Friday) at 7 p.m. featuring singing, speeches, instrumentals, dance, visual art, poetry, and a zany, video short of "Almost Almost, Maine!"

A link will be shared here on Facebook and on school website around showtime (7 p.m.) for the public to join in the fun! See the attached flyer for more information and keep an eye out for that link later today!

The SPHS Spring Play was originally scheduled to take to the Performing Arts Center stage this weekend, but the COVID-19 pandemic situation forced that and many other school events to be canceled. Looking for a fun and creative way for all of these amazing student-artists to exhibit their talents, the Theater Department came up with the idea for tonight's Virtual Spring Showcase! If you don't have plans later today and are looking for something fun to do we encourage to take in this event!

A link will be shared here on Facebook and on school website around showtime (7 p.m.) for the public to join in the fun! See the attached flyer for more information and keep an eye out for that link later today!

The SPHS Spring Play was originally scheduled to take to the Performing Arts Center stage this weekend, but the COVID-19 pandemic situation forced that and many other school events to be canceled. Looking for a fun and creative way for all of these amazing student-artists to exhibit their talents, the Theater Department came up with the idea for tonight's Virtual Spring Showcase! If you don't have plans later today and are looking for something fun to do we encourage to take in this event!

SPHS LOCKER ITEMS PICKUP: Any lockers at Saint Peter High School that still had personal items in them have been cleaned out in both the academic and athletic areas. Those items have been bagged up with the students' names put on them and those bags can be picked up tomorrow (Friday, May 8) from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. outside the main SPHS office entrance.

Tables will be set up outside the main entrance (E4) with SPHS staff members there to help out. SPHS students are welcome to drive up or pedal up to receive their bag of belongings during that time.

Pick up of locker and personal items from Saint Peter Middle School begins on Monday, May 11. More details on the Middle School pickup plan will be shared as they become available.

SAINTS STRONG EVENTS: Staff at North Elementary, South Elementary and the Early Childhood Center (for Pre-K thru grade 4) will host Saints Strong drive-thru parades starting at 6 p.m. on Thursday (May 7th) at each of those three buildings.

Students' families will drive through a designated route near each of the three buildings with staff standing nearby to greet the families from a safe social distance. Staff at each of the locations is planning for a special theme for their location and it promises to be a fun-filled event!

Maps for how the traffic will flow at each location on Thursday will be shared as soon as they become available. Social distancing will be practiced at each school as well. #SaintsStrong

GOLDEN TICKET WINNERS: The first Golden Ticket winners, through the weekly contest put on by Saint Peter Public Schools' kitchen staff, were recently announced! Congratulations to Annabelle Pool; Andy Davis; Ashlynn, Colin & Abby Esser, and Ryan Moelter!

Each week four Golden Tickets will be randomly placed inside a meal bag for each of the meal distribution pickup locations (South, North, and Middle School) as well as one of the bus routes. Each winner receives a $25 gift card to a local St. Peter restaurant. Congrats, once again, to this week's winners and thanks for your participation in the Saint Peter Public Schools' meal bag program!

One other note, graduation plans are still being finalized and will be shared with the seniors, their families, and the public on Tuesday, May 5.

post_text:
A NOTE FROM THE SPPS KITCHEN CREW (UPDATED): St. Peter Families -- Thank you for participating in the pick up meal program that we are offering to ensure all children have their nutritional needs met while we are participating in distance learning.

To thank everyone for participating in the meal program as well as to support our local restaurants and community, our food service provider A'viands, is sponsoring a Golden Ticket promotion.

Each week a "golden ticket" will be placed randomly in one meal bag at each of the pick up locations, South Elementary, North Elementary, and STP Middle School as well as a meal that is delivered by bus. The Golden Ticket will include instructions on how it can be redeemed for a $25 gift card for a local restaurant.

As Saint Peter Public Schools and A'viands continue to work together to serve our community, please know your participation and support has been greatly appreciated

Good luck finding your Golden Ticket!!!
St. Peter Kitchen Crew

post_text:
SPHS PARENT/TEACHER CONFERENCES: Saint Peter High School teachers will be hosting parent/teacher conferences (via phone call) from 3:30 to 7:30 p.m. on Tuesday, April 21. Parents/guardians of SPHS students (gr. 9-12) are welcome sign up for a time to connect with your students' teacher, via phone conference, by going to the Fast Scheduler link --> https://ptcfast.com/schools/St_Peter_High_School

When scheduling your conferences, please enter your phone number since teachers will be calling at the designated time. We know that phone conferences are not the most ideal way to conference, but we hope that you'll connect!

Please call the high school at 507/934-4212 or email Sandy Clementson at sclementson@stpeterschools.org if you have any questions.

post_text:
SPRING BREAK MEAL PACKS INFO: Saint Peter Schools will be offering FREE spring break meal packs for children ages 1-18. For menu and distribution information on the meal packs please go to --> https://bit.ly/2URLWMJ. The Spanish version can be found here --> https://bit.ly/3bWhyGE

Each child will receive a large bag of food to make breakfast and lunch for eight days. Meal Packs will be distributed at existing food distribution bus stops and may be picked up at South Elementary, North Elementary and SP Middle School from 7:30 to 9 a.m. and 11 a.m. to 12:45 p.m. on Wednesday, April 8. Meals will resume the regular distribution schedule on Thursday, April 16. (NOTE: It was originally reported meals distribution would resume on April 15, but that date is incorrect. There is enough food in the meal packs to last through Wednesday, April 15.)

post_text:
(EDITED TO REFLECT TIME CHANGE) Saint Peter Public Schools will join #BeTheLightMN campaign and light up Floyd B. Johnson Field on Mondays, starting tonight, at 8:20 p.m. (20:20 military time) for 20 minutes and 20 seconds in support of our schools and community. We are joining more than 150 other schools (and growing!) from around the state as part of this campaign.

Please do not gather at Johnson Field. Enjoy the lights from afar and follow social distancing guidelines. Also, if you are driving by Johnson Field at this time, please be courteous and respectful of others using the roads.

post_text: Here is one more to add for Friday's #DistanceLearningSaints, only this time it a short video clip. Shown here is Liv Bahr, kindergarten (Mrs. Sizer), doing a cup stacking exercise. Liv was assigned an Activity Bingo Card from her P.E. teacher Ms. Bergren this week. One of the items on the Bingo card was to make a cup stack. According to Liv's mom, she has always loved building things out of Dixie cups so, "she has A LOT of them! It took Liv and her dad about 45 minutes to build and as you can see about one second to deconstruct!"

Be sure to send your photos to him at kuhildebrandt@stpeterschools.org. Special thanks to all District 508 families and staff who have participated to date! We have received so many positive comments from people who enjoy seeing the photos! #DistanceLearningSaints

DISTRICT 508 COVID-19 UPDATE (MARCH 25TH) - District 508 residents can find the latest information in today's update from Saint Peter Superintendent Dr. Jeff Olson & staff by clicking on the following link --> COVID-19information@stpeterschools.org

Among the topics included are an update on when distance learning plans will be sent out to students and parents, and when the District-Wide Distance Learning Plan will be posted to the school website. There is also information on how students in grades 9-12, with devices in need of repair, can make an online repair request.

Over the next two days, our teachers and staff will be practicing how they connect with students and parents in preparation for the start of the distance learning on Monday, March 30. Remember, if you have any questions we ask that you please contact us via email at COVID-19information@stpeterschools.org. Thanks!

post_text:
MEAL DISTRIBUTION NUMBERS (UPDATED WITH MARCH 25TH INFO): After one week of District 508's meal distribution program, which provides breakfast and lunch for all kids in the district ages 18 and under during school days, we have seen it grow in popularity. The follow are the number of meals that have been distributed each day since the program began on March 18th, either at the bus stops or at one of the three pick up locations (Middle School, North Elementary and South Elementary):

March 18 - 837
March 19 - 1,197
March 20 - 1,384
March 23 - 1,414
March 24 - 1,914
March 25 - 2,051

For more information on District 508's meal distribution program go to https://www.stpeterschools.org/about/flu-prevention

MEAL DISTRIBUTION DAY #2 HIGHLIGHTS: The effort to provide breakfast and lunch to District 508 students entered its second day on Thursday. Buses, again, went out early in the morning to drop off food at stops throughout the communities of St. Peter and Kasota, and the three distribution sites (SPMS, North and South) continued to provide food for those dropping by those locations. Here are some photos of activity taking place today at the three distribution sites where food was provided.

If you have any questions or need information about the meal distribution program, please refer to the website at https://www.stpeterschools.org or by contacting the main office of your student(s)' school.

post_text:
DISTRICT 508 CORONAVIRUS UPDATE (TUESDAY) - Here is the latest info from District 508 on the Coronavirus (COVID-19) situation:

* District 508 has extended the time for school buildings to be open today (Tuesday), from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m., for students to pick up belongings and medications. Please enter those buildings through the main secured entrances. We do not have future plans to keep the buildings open to the public beyond Tuesday.

* A dedicated email address has been set-up for families who have questions about COVID-19 and Saint Peter Schools. Please send questions to COVID-19information@stpeterschools.org between 8 a.m. to 3 p.m., Monday through Friday. COVID-19 questions not related to Saint Peter Schools can be answered through the Minnesota state hotline at 651-201-3920 or 1-800-657-3903.

* We are finalizing plans for providing meals to all students under the age of 18 utilizing school transportation routes and designated pick up locations beginning on Wednesday. Detailed information will be sent out later today.
text:
DISTRICT 508 CORONAVIRUS UPDATE (TUESDAY) - Here is the latest info from District 508 on the Coronavirus (COVID-19) situation:

* District 508 has extended the time for school buildings to be open today (Tuesday), from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m., for students to pick up belongings and medications. Please enter those buildings through the main secured entrances. We do not have future plans to keep the buildings open to the public beyond Tuesday.

* A dedicated email address has been set-up for families who have questions about COVID-19 and Saint Peter Schools. Please send questions to COVID-19information@stpeterschools.org between 8 a.m. to 3 p.m., Monday through Friday. COVID-19 questions not related to Saint Peter Schools can be answered through the Minnesota state hotline at 651-201-3920 or 1-800-657-3903.

* We are finalizing plans for providing meals to all students under the age of 18 utilizing school transportation routes and designated pick up locations beginning on Wednesday. Detailed information will be sent out later today.

post_text: SCHOOL AGE CARE UPDATE: School Age Care (SAC) will be available to students in grades K-6 who have parents that work in healthcare, emergency medical services, long-term and post-acute care; law enforcement personnel; personnel providing correctional services; public health employees; firefighters or other first responders during the time that Governor Walz has ordered a statewide closure of schools. The district sent out a survey this morning to identify which students qualify for care. Contact Community & Family Education at (507) 934-3048 x. 2 for more information.

DISTRICT 508 CORONAVIRUS UPDATE (NEW): Saint Peter Public Schools will be closed beginning Monday, March 16 through Friday, March 27. Monday, March 16 and Tuesday, March 17, have been designated as Flexible Learning Days. Wednesday, March 18 through Friday, March 27, schools will be closed to allow staff time to develop comprehensive and long-term distance learning plans.

At the discretion of the parents and guardians, families and students are allowed to come to a school site between 8 a.m. and 4 p.m. tomorrow (Monday, March 16) to retrieve personal belongings and schools supplies.

See message from Saint Peter Superintendent Jeff Olson for more details --> https://www.stpeterschools.org/news-and-notes/isd508-news

More details will be released as they become available. Please contact your student(s)'s specific building principal's office if you have further questions.

Dear Saint Peter Schools Community and Families,

Minnesota Governor Tim Walz announced statewide school closures starting this week and provided local districts with guidance on how to proceed with the closures. The Saint Peter Schools administrative team is meeting to finalize plans for Saint Peter Schools on March 16th and 17th as well as during the extended March 18th - 27th closure. More specific information on the closures and plans will be shared later today (Sunday).

Sincerely,
Jeff Olson, PhD
Superintendent, Saint Peter Public Schools

SPRING ACTIVITIES REGISTRATION: With spring sports season just around the corner, here's a reminder that registration is now open for spring co-curricular activities. Please visit: http://bit.ly/STPActivitiesRegistration

Questions about how to set up a registration account? Click here: http://ss-resource.wordwareinc.com/resources/2027/files/Create%20New%20Lobby%20Account.pdf

Looking for spring schedules? www.thebigsouthconference.org. You can import specific schedules into your own calendar. A helpful guide on how to do that can be found here: http://bit.ly/ImportingActivitySchedules

Varsity Start Dates:
March 2nd - Adapted Bowling
March 9th - Track & Field and Softball
March 16th - Boys & Girls Golf and Baseball
March 23rd - Boys Tennis

Middle school baseball, softball, and track & field start dates are tentative based on weather and field conditions. Practices will start around April 1st for those activities.

If you have any questions about registration, please contact the SPHS Activities Office at 507-934-4212 Ext. 6025

BOYS BB PRE-SALE TICKETS: Pre-sale tickets will available for Saturday's St. Peter vs. Marshall Section 2AAA Boys BB semifinal game at Gustavus, which tips off at around 7:45 p.m. this Saturday. The pre-sale tickets will be available from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. tomorrow (Friday) at the SPHS Activities Office and cost is $8 for adults and $5 for students.

There still will be plenty of tickets available for purchase at the Lund Center on Saturday. The pre-sale is being done to help alleviate potential long ticket lines prior to the Saints/Tigers game, which is the second game of the evening. Top-seed Mankato East faces fourth-seed Hutchinson at Lund Center at 6 p.m. in the first semifinal game.

post_text:
STATE BOUND SAINTS! The SPHS Mock Trial varsity team headed off to St. Paul this morning (Thursday) for the 2020 Minnesota Mock Trial State Tournament, which takes place at the Ramsey County Courthouse. The Saints were given a rousing send-off by a large group of fellow students and SPHS staff members. Here are some photo highlights of the send-off!

State competition for the Saints begins today with the first round at 4:30 p.m. and the second round at 7 p.m. The third round takes place tomorrow (Friday) at 9 a.m. The championship final round is set for Friday at 2 p.m. at the Minnesota Supreme Court in the Minnesota Judicial Center in St. Paul. See the following website for more info --> https://www.mnbar.org/public-resources/mock-trial/state-tournament

Updates will be provided as they become available.

Good luck to the Saints' boys basketball team tonight (Wednesday) in their first round Section 2AAA playoff game vs. Willmar. The #3-seeded Saints battle the #6 Cardinals at 7 p.m. tonight here at the SPHS gym. Admission is $8 for adults and $5 for student, and a reminder that SPHS activities passes are NOT accepted.

The St. Peter/Willmar winner advances to Saturday's Section 2AAA semifinal round at Gustavus against either #2 Marshall or #7 Worthington at around 7:45 p.m. The first semifinal game on Saturday, starting at 6 p.m., will be between either #1 Mankato East or #8 New Ulm and #5 Mankato West or #4 Hutchinson. #GoSTPSaints

* Jonas Beugen, Executive Director at Tesfa International School in Columbia Heights

* Theodore Ihns, Superintendent at Howard-Winneshiek Community Schools, Cresco, Iowa
* Michael Neubeck, Middle School Principal at Mahtomedi
* Jason Mix, Principal at Howard Lake-Waverly-Winsted High School

STATE MEDAL WINNER! Congrats to SPHS senior wrestling standout Eli Hunt who capped his prep career Saturday with a fifth-place finish in the Class AA 170-pound weight class at the MN State Wrestling Tourney. Hunt, who placed sixth at state last year, went 4-2 this past weekend during action at the Xcel Energy Center including defeating Nathan Simmonds of Fairmont/Martin County West in the fifth-place match.

Senior Wareke Gillette also competed at state in the 152-pound class, but did not place. Kudos to both Eli and Wareke and the rest of the Saints wrestlers on completion of a historic season which included a runner-up finish in the Section 2AA Team Tournament. Hunt and Gillette are shown here with some of their teammates at the state send-off on Thursday.

Yamaha Performing Artist and famed trumpeter Allen Vizzutti is visiting Saint Peter High School this weekend.Vizzutti put on a MasterClass for band students from St. Peter, Cleveland, and Austin early Friday afternoon at the SPHS Performing Arts Center (PAC). He also spent time working with the students in smaller groups throughout the day.

Vizzuitti will appear in concert with the St. Peter and Cleveland HS concert and jazz bands at 3 p.m. tomorrow (Saturday) in the St. Peter Performing Arts Center. There are still tickets available and they can be obtained by contacting SPHS band director Dave Haugh at dhaugh@stpeterschools.org.

Here are some photo highlights of Allen Vizzutti's MasterClass session at the PAC.

post_text:
North Elementary fourth graders, along with fourth graders from John Ireland School, took part in the annual Kindness Retreat on Thursday (Feb. 27) at Johnson Hall (Nicollet County Fairgrounds).

Youth Frontiers, whose mission is to provide schools with experiences that inspire character, civility and community puts on the event each year. Youth Frontiers staff members, Jacob Niewinski and Dahlia Jones, were on hand to provide around 150 fourth graders a high-energy day which provided them tools to develop empathy, promote kindness and prevent bullying.

A group of 35 members of Saint Peter High School's National Honor Society chapter also helped out by serving as small group leaders during the retreat.

The Kindness Retreat is made possible by a grant through the Mankato Clinic Foundation. Here are some photo highlights of the retreat!

post_text:
SECTION 2AAA GBB TOURNEY: Kudos to the St. Peter girls basketball team for its impressive 59-47 win over host Hutchinson in opening round of Section 2AAA Tourney on Wednesday. The fourth-seeded Saints (21-5 overall) face top-seed Marshall (26-0) at 6 p.m. tomorrow (Saturday) at Gustavus in the semifinal round. Admission at the gate is $8 for adults & $5 for students.

The Saints/Tigers winner advances to face either second-seed Waconia or third-seed Mankato West in the Section 2AAA championship on Thursday, March 5 at 7 p.m., also at Gustavus. The Wildcats & Scarlets will face off in the other semifinal game at Gustavus on Saturday, following the St. Peter/Marshall tilt.

post_text:
Good luck to SPHS senior wrestlers Wareke Gillette (152) and Eli Hunt (170) as they compete today (Friday) at the MN State Class AA Wrestling Tournament at the Xcel Energy Center in St. Paul.

Class AA individual first round matches begin at 11 a.m. with AA quarterfinal round and first round of wrestlebacks also taking place later tonight. Consolation and championship round state matches continue on Saturday starting at 9 a.m. at the Xcel Energy Center. For ticket information go to https://legacy.mshsl.org/mshsl/activitypage.asp?actnum=424

Gillette (31-7 overall) is seeded sixth in the 16-person bracket and faces Mound-Westonka's Seth Anderson (30-6) to open state action. Hunt (37-3) is the third seed and takes on New Ulm's Cole Ranweiler (38-7) in his first-round match.

Saints fans can watch Wareke & Eli's state matches online at www.prepspotlight.tv. You can also keep up to date on results at www.trackwrestling.com and search for the MSHSL link.

post_text:
Saint Peter High School’s instrumental music department hosts famed trumpeter Allen Vizzutti tomorrow (Friday) and Saturday.

Vizzutti, who is a Yamaha Performing Artist, will put on a MasterClass at 12:30 p.m. on Friday, Feb. 28, for Saint Peter and Cleveland high school students as well as several other area high school and college students in the SPHS Performing Arts Center (PAC). The public is invited to attend this session free of charge.

In addition to his MasterClass, Vizzuitti will appear in concert with the St. Peter and Cleveland HS concert and jazz bands at 3 p.m. on Saturday (Feb. 29) at the PAC. Tickets are $8 for adults and $5 for student. Please contact SPHS band director Dave Haugh at dhaugh@stpeterschools.org to buy tickets in advance and for more information.

Additional information about Allen Vizzutti is available on his website at vizzutti.com.

This activity is made possible in part by a grant from the Prairie Lakes Regional Arts Council with funds appropriated by the Minnesota State Legislature from its general fund.

post_text:
NATIONAL FFA WEEK: This week the Saint Peter High School/South Central Agri-Science Academy FFA chapter has celebrated National FFA Week with a variety of activities. Today (Thursday) the local FFA chapter hosted its annual Farm-To-Table Lunch as well as its Career Day Expo in the commons area.

Today's lunch menu at SPHS featured bacon-related items on the menu including bacon wrapped pork loin, bacon cheeseburger, and bacon & Brussels sprout salad. Some of the tomatoes used in the menu items were also raised in the SPHS greenhouse and the bacon was produced from pigs that were raised by Gran family.

Several ag-related in the area also had representatives here during lunch time to talk about careers in their fields and possible job opportunities with their companies.

Earlier this week the FFA members had a game day in which they played bean bags/cornhole during Saints Time and on Friday they will serving SPHS staff during their Faculty & Staff Appreciation Breakfast.

Here are some photo highlights from some of this week's festivities.

Those two Saints' standouts are heading for the Xcel Energy Center in St. Paul where they will wrestle in the first round of state competition tomorrow (Thursday) sometime after 11 a.m.

A large group of family, friends, classmates & staff gathered to wish them good luck and give the state-bound Saints a rousing send off! Here are some photo highlights. #GoSTPSaints

post_text:
STATE BOUND SAINTS!!! Congrats to SPHS senior wrestling standouts Wareke Gillette (152) and Eli Hunt (170) for qualifying for the MN State Class AA Wrestling Tournament after winning titles at the Section 2AA Tournament yesterday at Hutchinson.

Gillette earned his first state trip with a thrilling 3-1 decision over Hutchinson's Cale Luthens in the 152-pound championship match, while Hunt earned a second state trip with a 13-4 major decision win over Tri-City United's Brady Rud in the 170-pound title bout.

Both Saints will head to St. Paul later this week to compete at state at the Xcel Energy Center. Pairings will be announced later today and that info will be shared when it becomes available!

Two other Saints, eighth grader Nakiye Mercado (106) and freshman Amir Loredo-Hollon (120) just missed joining Gillette and Hunt in St. Paul as they finished third at the section meet, one place short of a state berth. In all, the Saints had nine medal winners at the Section 2AA meet.

SECTION 2AA INDIVIDUAL WRESTLING: Best of luck to SPHS varsity wrestlers competing at the Section 2AA Individual Tourney which starts today (Friday) at 5 p.m. at Hutchinson High School and continues tomorrow (Saturday) at 11 a.m. Tickets for each day are $8 for adults and $5 for students, with doors opening at 3:45 p.m. today and 9:45 a.m. tomorrow.

There will two championship rounds and a consolation preliminary round tonight (Friday) with the rest of the tournament taking place on Saturday. The top two wrestlers at each weight class advance to the MN State Class AA Wrestling Tourney at the Xcel Energy Center in St. Paul on Feb. 28-29. Live results can be found at https://www.trackwrestling.com/

Other teams competing in the Section 2AA tourney, besides St. Peter, includes Delano, Glencoe-Silver Lake, Hutchinson/Buffalo Lake-Hector-Stewart, Mankato East, Mankato West, Scott West, Tri-City United, Waseca, and Watertown-Mayer/Mayer Lutheran.

post_text:
Congrats to SPHS junior Aiden Teegarden, who played the baritone saxophone at Orchestra Hall this past weekend with the Minnesota All State Symphonic Band! Aiden was accepted into the MN All State Symphonic Band in May 2019.

"We had a camp in the summer time and then we had a mid-winter clinic where we all met again and then we played at Orchestra Hall," Aiden said. "It's an audition-only group where only about 15 of 80 applicants for saxophone are accepted. It was amazing to play with musicians at the same level as me who really enjoy playing music."
text:

"We had a camp in the summer time and then we had a mid-winter clinic where we all met again and then we played at Orchestra Hall," Aiden said. "It's an audition-only group where only about 15 of 80 applicants for saxophone are accepted. It was amazing to play with musicians at the same level as me who really enjoy playing music."

post_text:
Several Saint Peter High School students and some staff members made the trek up to St. Paul today to take in a Minnesota House of Representatives' Agricultural Committee meeting. Part of the discussions at the meeting focused on "Landon's Law," which aims to enhance safety for those working on or around grain bins.

The law is named after Landon Gran, a member of the SPHS Class of 2020 who passed away in a farming accident this past summer. Landon's mother, Michele, and his brother, James, were also in attendance and addressed the committee during the meeting. The SPHS contingent was invited to the meeting by State Representative Jeff Brand of St. Peter who is part of the committee.

Here are some photos from today's committee meeting. Thanks to those who contributed these photos from the meeting.

post_text:
Good luck to the MN River boys hockey team as they take on Mankato East/Loyola in the quarterfinal round of the Section 1A Tourney at 7:30 p.m. tonight at All Seasons Arena in Mankato. Tickets are $8 for adults and $5 for students.

The winner of tonight's #5-seeded Bulldogs and #4-seeded Cougars game advances to Saturday's semifinal round against either #1 Dodge County or #8 Winona at 11:30 a.m. at the Rochester Rec Center. The Section 1A championship is set for Wednesday, Feb. 26, at 7 p.m. at the Rochester Rec Center. #GoMNRiverBulldogs

post_text: SPHS SIGNING DAY: Saint Peter High School had six of its senior student-athletes sign letters of intent today to continue their athletic careers at the collegiate level. Shown here during the signing ceremony, held during Saints Time, are (l to r) Eli Hunt (Concordia, Moorhead - wrestling), Amelia Carlson (St. Norbert, De Pere, Wis. - soccer), Michael Connor (Concordia, Moorhead - football), Carson Kennedy (Gustavus - football), Allie McCabe (Iowa Lakes CC, Estherville, Iowa - softball), and Allie Madden (Morningside, Sioux City, Iowa - track).

post_text:
CONCERT REMINDER - Famed trumpter Allen Vizzutti will appear in concert, along with the Saint Peter High School and Cleveland High School concert & jazz bands, at 3 p.m. on Saturday, Feb. 29, at the SPHS Performing Arts Center. Tickets are $8 for adults and $5 for student. Please contact SPHS band director Dave Haugh at dhaugh@stpeterschools.org to buy tickets in advance and for more information.

Vizzutti, who is a Yamaha Performing Artist, will also put on a MasterClass at 12:30 p.m. on Friday, Feb. 28, for Saint Peter and Cleveland high school students as well as several other area high school and college students.

This activity is made possible in part by a grant from the Prairie Lakes Regional Arts Council with funds appropriated by the Minnesota State Legislature from its general fund.

post_text:
SECTION 2AA RUNNER-UP: Congrats to the St. Peter wrestling team for earning runner-up honors in the Section 2AA Tournament on Saturday, the Saints' highest finish since 1994. The Saints upset #1 seed and perennial power Scott West 33-27 in the semifinal round at Mankato West on Saturday, before losing a heart breaking 35-30 decision to #2-seed Hutchinson in the title match later in the day.

The Saints will now compete in the Section 2AA Individual Tourney on Feb. 21-22 at Hutch.

Another highlight from the Section 2AA team tournament on Saturday was that Eli Hunt recorded his 86th pin vs. Hutchinson, setting a new SPHS record held previously for former Saints standout Kevin Ohm. #CongratsSTPSaints #NotDoneYet

post_text:
STATE BOUND!!! Congrats to the SPHS Varsity Mock Trial team for earning a trip to the Minnesota State Mock Trial Tournament by defeating Rochester Century in the Region 5 championship on Friday.

Team members pictured here, include:. front row, Miranda Seham, Paige Meyer, Rahima Jamac; back row, Rahma Jamac, Anna LoFaro, John Borgmeier, Charlie Redmond, Erin Hill, and Sophie Matarrese. Head coach is Dan Clark.

The Saints advance to the state tournament in St. Paul on March 5-6 and will compete against Cloquet, Albany, Watertown-Mayer, Luverne, Northfield, Nova Classical Academy, Visitation, Eastview, East Ridge, Apple Valley, Breck, Eden Prairie, Lakeville North and Lakeville South.

More details will be released as they become available.

post_text:
Spring registration is now open for Saint Peter High School co-curricular activities. Please visit: http://bit.ly/STPActivitiesRegistration

Questions about how to set up a registration account? Click here: http://ss-resource.wordwareinc.com/resources/2027/files/Create%20New%20Lobby%20Account.pdf

Looking for spring schedules? Go to www.thebigsouthconference.org. You can import specific schedules into your own calendar. A helpful guide on how to do that can be found here: http://bit.ly/ImportingActivitySchedules

Varsity Start Dates:
March 2nd - Adapted Bowling
March 9th - Track & Field and Softball
March 16th - Boys & Girls Golf and Baseball
March 23rd - Boys Tennis

Middle school baseball, softball, and track & field start dates are tentative based on weather and field conditions. Practices will start around April 1st for those activities.

If you have any questions about registration, please contact the Activities Office at 507-934-4212, ext. 6025

SPHS SNOW WEEK KING & QUEEN - Congrats to SPHS seniors Ethan Niemeyer, son of Heidi & Mike Niemeyer, and Rahma Jamac, daughter of Kawthar Abdi and Mohamed Abdulkadir, who were crowned Snow Week King & Queen at this morning's annual coronation, which took place in the SPHS Performing Arts Center.

Also shown here are the Snow Week candidates & the rest of the court. They included: front row (l to r), pages Caleb Gilbertson and Zoey Rothenberger; back row, Homecoming King Matthew Springer, Ella Rosburg, Carson Kennedy, Aubrey Landsom, Noah Faulstich, Izzy Lind, Harry Dean, Ariel Benavidez, Kai Anderson, Ayla Aydogdu, King Ethan Niemeyer, Queen Rahma Jamac, Gabe Wilson, Marina Sawyer, Josh Ellerbeck, Nicole Schilling, Brad Doherty-Bohn, Amelia Carlson, Anders Taylor, Brielle Bushaw, Josh Johnson, and Homecoming Queen Katie Engeldinger.

post_text:
A large group of Saint Peter High School students in Vero Castillo-Clark's or Dan Engelhorn's Spanish classes made the trek to the MN Zoo in Apple Valley for the annual Spanish Day exhibit on Tuesday (Feb. 11). Several of the Spanish 4 students participated in the event as presenters while the rest toured the zoo to take in at least 15 of the 40 exhibits to get their 'passport' stamped. Students of all ages from around Minnesota attended the event.

Here are some photo highlights of the groups that presented as well as those that toured!

SAINT PETER SCHOOLS CLOSING EARLY: Due to expected inclement weather, Saint Peter Public Schools are closing early today (Wednesday). The following are the dismissal times:

Early Childhood -- 12:30 p.m.
South Elementary -- 12:45 p.m.
North Elementary -- 12:50 p.m.
High School -- 12:50 p.m.
Middle School -- 1 p.m.

There will be NO afternoon preschool today and all SPPS activities and practices are canceled for today.

SECTION 2A GYMNASTICS INFO: State tourney berths will be on the line when the St. Peter girls gymnastics team travels to Glencoe to compete in the Section 2A Meet on Thursday, Feb. 13, with competition beginning at 5:30 p.m. at the Glencoe-Silver Lake High School Field House gym.

Doors open at 4:30 p.m. and admission is $7 for adults and $5 for students. The top overall team, the top three all-around scorers, and the top three individual event placewinners advance to state, set for Feb. 21-22 at Roy Wilkins Auditorium in St. Paul.

Teams competing at the Section 2A meet include, St. Peter, Blue Earth Area, Faribault, New Ulm/NUACS/MVL, Mankato West, Mankato East, Glencoe-Silver Lake, Waseca, and St. James. #GoodLuckSaintsGymnasts

post_text: The live blues musical performance of "Thunder Knocking on the Door" is set for Thursday, Feb. 27, at 7 p.m. in the SPHS Performing Arts Center. This show was written by Keith Glover, with music by Keb'Mo' and Anderson Edwards, and produced by Ten Thousand Things Theater. This is a theater-in-the-round show so seating is limited. Please reserve your free tickets by calling 507-934-3048, ext. 1. For more information please see that accompanying flyer.

post_text: COURSE & CURRICULUM NIGHT - Saint Peter High School will host its first-ever Course & Curriculum Night this Thursday (Feb. 13) from 3:30 to 7:30 p.m. to give families of next year's SPHS students and families a chance to meet school staff and learn about course selection and offerings. There also will be sessions to find out more information on the registration process, the role of parents, and the timeline for submitting 2020-21 registration requests. See attached flyer for more details!

It's Snow Week at Saint Peter High School this week with numerous fun activities planned each day. A kickoff pepfest was held last Friday at the gym during Saints Time as the Snow Week candidates dressed up accordingly to reflect the dress up themes for each day this week.

The Snow Week dress up days are as follows:
Monday, Feb. 10 - Cozy Day
Tuesday, Feb. 11 - Decade Day
Wednesday, Feb. 12 - Space Day
Thursday, Feb. 13 - Throwback Day
Friday, Feb. 14 - Class Color Day (Seniors - black, Juniors - red, Sophomores - gray, Freshman
- pink)

Here are some photo highlights of last Friday's pepfest.

post_text:
PRE-SALE TICKET UPDATE: There are only about 80 pre-sale tickets left for tomorrow's girls & boys hoops doubleheader between Minnehaha Academy & St. Peter. Tickets are $7 for adults and $5 for students or free with an SPHS activities pass, but you must show your pass to get a ticket. You can get your pre-sale tickets today (Friday) until around 4 p.m. in the SPHS activities office. A limited number of tickets will be available tomorrow (Saturday) for sale or for free for SPHS activities pass holders, but once those tickets are gone no further admissions will be allowed.

Doors open at 1 p.m. tomorrow with the girls game tipping off at 2 p.m. and the boys at 4 p.m. at the SPHS gym.

SECTION 2A GIRLS HOCKEY - Good luck to the Minnesota River girls hockey team as the sixth-seeded Bulldogs head to New Ulm tonight to face the third-seeded Eagles in the first round of the Section 2A playoffs starting at 7 p.m. Tickets are $8 for adults and $5 for students.

The MN River/New Ulm winner advances to the Section 2A semifinal round on Saturday against either #2 Hutchinson or #7 Waconia. Game time would be at 7:30 p.m. at the higher seed. The Section 2A title game is set for Thursday, Feb. 13, at Gustavus Adolphus College at 7:30 p.m. #GoBulldogsHockey

REMINDER: Saint Peter High School and its Building Leadership Team are hosting a parent information and advisory gathering today (Wednesday) at 5:30 p.m. in the SPHS Community Room (next to commons area). Parents/guardians of students in grades 9-12 are welcome to attend.

At this first meeting, the BLT would like to gather information and feedback on programming, policies, and practices, as well as share information on some of the things the team is working on this year. We hope to see you there!

post_text:
The Saint Peter High School speech team kicked off the 2020 season with a tournament at Prior Lake this past Saturday, competing against mostly larger AA schools. Josh Ellerbeck earned champion honors in Humorous to lead the Saints' speakers while David Marlow (Creative) and Lilliana Hughes (Storytelling) were finalists. Honorable mention recognition was given to Paige Meyer (Extemporaneous Reading) and Rahima Jamac (Poetry).

SPHS speech team members competing at Prior Lake, and shown in accompanying photo, include: front row (l to r), Konrad Wernsing, Tara Harbo, Lillie Sund, Anna Boomgarden, Maya Winsell, head coach Erika Gustafson; second row, Madison Abels, Rahma Jamac, Hannah Wohlers, Rahima Jamac, Paige Meyer; third row, assistant coach Isabel Zwaschka, Josh Ellerbeck, Elliot Schrumpf, Molly Leonard, Madi Winsell; back row, Vanessa Krueger, Obet Alcantara-Alvarez, Anders Taylor, David Marlow, Eleanor Kennedy, and Emma Smith.

The Saints return to action this Saturday (Feb. 8) with a meet at Mankato Loyola.

WRESTLERS TO HOST TAKE DOWN CANCER EVENT: St. Peter's wrestling team hosts its final home meets of the season tonight (Thursday) against Blue Earth Area, Tri-City United, and Scott West. The Saints will host its annual Take Down Cancer Night fundraiser tonight, in conjunction with Senior Night and Youth Family Night.

St. Peter wrestles Blue Earth Area at 5 p.m. tonight in the SPHS gym followed by Scott West at 6:30 p.m. and TCU at 8 p.m. The Take Down Cancer event will benefit Ann Volk, who recently "Took Down Cancer."!

Come on out to see some great wrestling action and support a great cause!

post_text:
Saint Peter High School students heard words of encouragement from Bukata Hayes, executive director for the Greater Mankato Diversity Council, during Saints Time on Monday morning. Bukata, a well-known guest speaker in this area, stressed three main points by telling SPHS students to:

* Embrace Your Story
* Respect Each Other's Story
* Support Each Other's Story

He also shared personal experiences from his own life where he used that philosophy and how it impacted his life. Here are a couple of photo highlights from Bukata's talk with SPHS students.

Those attending activities/events at the Middle School need to park in one of the school's adjacent lots. post_text:
SPHS SAFE SPORTS SCHOOL BANNER: Saint Peter High School recenty was named as a recipient of the National Athletic Trainers’ Association (NATA) Safe Sports School second team award for its Saints’ athletic program. The award champions safety and recognizes secondary schools that provide safe environments for student athletes. The award also reinforces the importance of providing the best level of care, injury prevention, and treatment.

SPHS recently received its banner commemorating the NATA Safe Sports School award. Shown here in accompanying photo is Saints' athletic trainer Leah Rutz (second row, fourth from the right) and some of her SPHS student-athletes with the banner.

post_text:
Saint Peter High School’s instrumental music department will host famed trumpeter Allen Vizzutti on February 28 and 29. Vizzutti, who is a Yamaha Performing Artist, will put on a MasterClass at 12:30 p.m. on Friday, Feb. 28, for Saint Peter and Cleveland high school students as well as several other area high school and college students.

In addition to his MasterClass, Vizzuitti will appear in concert with the St. Peter and Cleveland HS concert and jazz bands at 3 p.m. on Saturday, Feb. 29, in the St. Peter Performing Arts Center. Tickets are $8 for adults and $5 for student. Please contact SPHS band director Dave Haugh at dhaugh@stpeterschools.org to buy tickets in advance and for more information.

To learn more about Allen Vizzuitti and his appearance here at SPHS go to https://www.stpeterschools.org/news-and-notes/arts-activities-news

post_text:
Saint Peter Superintendent Jeff Olson issued the following statement about Minnesota Governor Tim Walz proclaiming this week as Paraprofessional Recognition Week:

"Governor Tim Walz has proclaimed the week of January 27 through January 31, 2020 Paraprofessional Recognition Week.

In the proclamation, Governor Walz noted that the support and services provided by paraprofessionals are integral to student achievement. I concur!

Please join me in thanking our Paraprofessional Educators of Saint Peter for their hard work and dedication in meeting the needs of our students."

To see a copy of Gov. Walz's proclamation see the accompanying document!

post_text:
SAINTS ONE-ACT ADVANCES!!! Congrats to the SPHS One-Act Play cast & crew for placing third out of seven schools competing in the Section 2AA, Sub-Section A contest this past Saturday at the SPHS Performing Arts Center.

The Saints rendition of "Squirrel Girl Goes to College", along with champion New Prague and runner-up Dassel-Cokato, advance to Saturday's (Feb. 1) Section 2AA Contest at Shakopee High School. More details on the Section 2AA Contest will be released as they become available. #GoodLuckSaintsThespians

The SPHS's One Act Play cast & crew includes: front row (l to r), Sarah Fadness, Julie Marlow, Jaden Neubauer, Gloria Toupence, Madelyn Tollefson, Bryan Harroun; middle row, Breeley Ruble, Katie Engeldinger, Noah Faulstich, Sky Gassman, Matthew Springer, Marina Sawyer, Ayla Aydogdu, Ethan Niemeyer; back row, Jack Leonard and Wesley Toupence. Not pictured are directors Jason Toupence and Amanda Blue.

SUB-SECTION ONE-ACT PLAY INFO: Saint Peter High School’s One-Act Play cast and crew will compete in the Section 2AA, Subsection A contest tomorrow (Saturday, Jan. 25), here starting at 9 a.m. at the SPHS Performing Arts Center (PAC) with doors opening at 8:30 a.m. Admission is free and open to the public.

This year’s SPHS production is "Squirrel Girl Goes to College", and is being directed by Jason Toupence and Amanda Blue. Other schools competing, in addition to St. Peter, includes Dassel-Cokato, New Ulm, Hutchinson, Marshall, Orono, and New Prague. Because of Section 2AA rules, the schedule of performances is not available to the public.

SPHS's One Act Play cast & crew includes: front row (l to r), Sarah Fadness, Julie Marlow, Jaden Neubauer, Gloria Toupence, Madelyn Tollefson, Bryan Harroun; middle row, Breeley Ruble, Katie Engeldinger, Noah Faulstich, Sky Gassman, Matthew Springer, Marina Sawyer, Ayla Aydogdu, Ethan Niemeyer; back row, Jack Leonard and Wesley Toupence.

post_text:
COMMUNITY LISTENING SESSION REMINDER: The St. Peter Public School District is conducting a search for a new superintendent and will host the second of two community listening sessions tonight (Thursday, Jan. 23) at 6:30 p.m. in the Saint Peter Middle School media center. Please enter through Entrance A off Capitol Drive (cul de sac area).

The St. Peter School Board is working with the Minnesota School Boards Association (MSBA) to provide guidance and assist with the planning. MSBA search consultants will be on hand tonight to facilitate the listening session.

The information collected will be used to help shape the candidate interview questions. All community members are invited to participate.

Another way for the community to assist in the search process is to fill out the online version of the Saint Peter Public Schools Superintendent Search Survey by going to https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/8G9K5NJ. To request a paper copy of the survey, please contact Sarah Janovsky at (507) 934-5703 or sjanovsky@stpeterschools.org. The deadline to fill it out is tomorrow (Friday, Jan. 24).

MSU-Mankato's Children's Theater Tour made its annual stops at South Elementary and North Elementary today (Tuesday) to stage the department's own original production of "A Knight's Tail". Funding for the performances was provided by the South Parents Council and North's Parent Teacher Organization (PTO).

Here are some photo highlights from the fun-filled event at both schools. For more information on this year's MSU Children's Theater Tour check out the following story from MSU's Today publication --> http://today.mnsu.edu/2020/01/21/play-time/

post_text: HOCKEY FIGHTS CANCER NIGHT: The MN River Bulldogs girls and boys varsity hockey teams are hosting their second annual Hockey Fights Cancer Night tonight (Tuesday, Jan. 14) as part of their doubleheader against Fairmont in Le Sueur. The Bulldogs' girls team hits the ice 5:30 p.m. against the Cardinals with the boys varsity game starting at around 7:30 p.m. This event is to help raise awareness and funds to help find a cure for cancer. A taco-in-a-bag meal is being offered as well as other special events.

post_text:
Michael Reeser, SPHS industrial technology instructor, along with staff from Tri-City United and Le Sueur-Henderson schools met recently with representatives from Winco, Inc. Winco is generously donating small engines and generators to the three schools to be used in the classrooms and Mr. Reeser and the other school reps were on hand to pick out what they could use for their respective schools.

Winco has been very open to partnering with local schools including having hosted SPHS students in a tour in June as well as allowing TCU for job shadows in November. Here are some photos from Mr. Reeser's and the other school reps' recent visit to Winco's Le Center facility.

post_text: The third annual North Elementary Clothes Closet event was held on November 23 and around 50 people came to the school to pick out warm clothing for use during the winter months. Donations of gently used coats, hats, mittens, and boots were collected at North Elementary, South Elementary, and the Middle School for the Clothes Closet. Included here are some photo highlights of organizer Quinn Rassbach, her former teacher at North, Breanna Steele, and the rest of the crew who helped with the event. For more details go to the following link --> https://www.stpeterschools.org/news-and-notes/k-4-news

There will be no charge for the valet parking service, but tips will be accepted. All tips collected that evening will go to help fund the SPHS Marching Band's upcoming trip to Memphis, Tenn., to perform at the AutoZone Liberty Bowl college football game on December 31. More details on that trip will be shared next week!

Tickets for Lorie Line's concert are still available through her website at https://www.lorieline.com/tour.php.

post_text: SPPS SCHOOLS CLOSED NOV. 27: Due to the current weather situation, all grades Pre-K to grade 8 parent teacher conferences scheduled for Wednesday, Nov. 27, have been cancelled and will be rescheduled at later dates. In addition, there will be no school for grades 9-12 high school students on Wednesday, Nov. 27. For our 9-12 high school students, we will be implementing a “Flexible Learning Day.” Also, all school activities and practices scheduled for Wednesday, Nov. 27, have been cancelled.

For our 9-12 high school students, we will be implementing a “Flexible Learning Day.” Also, all school activities and practices scheduled for Wednesday, Nov. 27, have been cancelled.

post_text: NORTH TURKEY BINGO: An annual Thanksgiving tradition was revived at North Elementary at the end of the school day on Tuesday as students played Turkey Bingo. Students participated in the game in their classrooms and if they won they were required to walk down to the cafeteria area, while "flapping their wings" and doing their best rendition of a turkey call, to claim their prize. Here are some photo highlights from the fun activity!

Because of this change, there will be no junior varsity game, which has been postponed to a date and time to be determined.

post_text:
SPMS PENNIES FOR PATIENTS FUNDRAISER: Saint Peter Middle School students (gr. 5-8) raised $323 during their annual Penny Wars fundraiser for the Pennies for Patients program. The students collected the pennies, along with other coins and bills, during a recent two week stretch (Nov. 11-22).

Members of the SPMS Executive Student Council, and their advisor Leah Knutson, brought all of the donations down to HomeTown Bank on Monday morning to be counted. Those Executive Student Council members making the delivery included eighth graders Janelle Ceja and Josie Schmahl along with seventh graders Gretta Baker, Carl Jenkins, Emmy Remmert, Tobias Twait, Nora Whipps, and Cecily Winterfeldt.

Pennies for Patients connects schools with local blood cancer patients, provides tangible life skills to participants, and allows students to see the impact they’re making in the lives of others. Pennies For Patients raises funds in support of The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society (LLS).

Here are some photos from this morning's activities in delivering the Pennies for Patients donation.

post_text:
RAPTOR CENTER PROGRAM AT SOUTH: South Elementary students and staff had the opportunity to see a raptor up close when staff from the Raptor Center of Minnesota paid a visit to the school to present a program on November 22. This exciting program is based on raptors of Minnesota and founded on national science standards, and creates an unforgettable experience for the students.

The Raptors of Minnesota program explores different raptors (birds of prey) found in Minnesota and their role in the environment. Participants learn some raptor identification, habitats where different species are found, key adaptations that make raptors different than other birds, and amazing success stories of what is possible when we come together to protect wildlife and their environments.

Saint Peter Community & Family Education is looking for eight students who are at least 16 years old and in good standing with the school to work in our School Age Care (SAC) Programs located at both North and South Elementary. Students will work 6-9 hours per week.

FALL PLAY OPENS TONIGHT! One last reminder, the SPHS fall play production of Disney's "Beauty & the Beast" runs tonight through Sunday at the Performing Arts Center. Show times are 7:30 tonight, Friday and Saturday with a 2 p.m. show on Sunday. Reserved tickets can be purchased through the following link --> https://stpeter.epaytrak.com/ and they will also be sold at the Performing Arts Center box office before the show. Cost is $12 for general public and $2 for SPPS students and staff and doors open at 6:30 p.m.

This photo display is a tribute to those "behind the scenes" crew members who help make putting on a show like Beauty & the Beast possible.

MIDDLE SCHOOL LINCOLN DRIVE ACCESS: A reminder that those Middle School parents wishing to pick up or drop off their students AFTER 3:30 p.m. on school days or any time during weekends should enter Lincoln Drive from Grace Street and can then make a u-turn at the Gym Lobby Entrance area. Door H will be open for sports entrance for practices. Gym lobby doors will be open for games. Vehicles should not go beyond barrier on the Broadway end of Lincoln Drive

Shown here is a diagram of the traffic flow for school days after 3:30 p.m. and on weekends when dropping off or picking up at the gym. For more information please contact Barb Regner, Saint Peter Public Schools' Physical Plant/Facility Use Coordinator, at bregner@stpeterschools.org.

NORTH'S CLOTHES CLOSET: The third annual North's Clothes Closet event is set for this Saturday (Nov. 23) from 9 a.m. to noon at the North Elementary gym. This event is all free and open to anyone in the community! People can just stop by during that time to shop for the warm clothes they need before the winter comes! They have all sizes from kids to adults.

Donations of gently used coats, hats, mittens, and boots are still being collected at North Elementary, South Elementary, and the Middle School. Drop off boxes are located by the offices at each of those buildings.

For more information about North's Clothes Closet 2019 event check out the following video put together by the event founder Quinn Rassbach and friends --> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IcAMgjJEl2Q&feature=emb_title

post_text: Congrats to Minnesota River Bulldogs girls' hockey goalie and SPHS senior Madi Kisor for being nominated recently for MN Hockey Hub's Top Performer honors. Kisor was chosen for her efforts in the Bulldogs thrilling 2-1 season-opening OT win over Litchfield/Dassel-Cokato where the senior net minder made 57 saves including 8 in overtime. To vote for Madi go to https://www.mngirlshockeyhub.com/news_article/show/1065832 and scroll to bottom of the page to cast your ballot!
