post_text:
STATE SWIMMING UPDATE: Saints junior Morgan Kelly is assured of a state swimming medal after she turned in the third best time overall in the 100 Breaststroke at today's prelims at the MN State Swimming & Diving Meet at the U of M Aquatics Center in Minneapolis. She will now swim in tomorrow's final round which begins at noon on Saturday. Morgan also qualified for the consolation finals in the 200 Individual Medley.

The girls 200 Medley Relay team of Shelby Graft, Kelly, Jaiden Landsom, and Olivia Denzer, just missed the consolation finals by just two places as the Saints foursome ended up 18th overall (top 16 move on). Senior Lauren Feder placed 28th in the diving competition on Thursday to cap her outstanding career.

To watch Kelly compete in the state swimming finals on Saturday go to www.prepspotlight.tv.

STATE BOUND SAINTS SEND-OFF: A send-off celebration for the SPHS swimmers and diver, who are heading to state early tomorrow morning, was held this afternoon on the west end of the high school building.

Diving prelims start at noon tomorrow (Thursday) at the U of M Aquatics Center in Minneapolis with Lauren Feder competing. Swimming prelims start at noon on Friday with Morgan Kelly competing in the 200 IM and 100 Breaststroke and Kelly will team up with Shelby Graft, Jaiden Landson, and Olivia Denzer in the 200 Medley Relay. Swimming and diving finals are set for noon on Saturday. You can watch the action live online at www.prepspotlight.tv. Here are some photos from today's send off!

Diving prelims start at noon tomorrow (Thursday) at the U of M Aquatics Center in Minneapolis with Lauren Feder competing. Swimming prelims start at noon on Friday with Morgan Kelly competing in the 200 IM and 100 Breaststroke and Kelly will team up with Shelby Graft, Jaiden Landson, and Olivia Denzer in the 200 Medley Relay. Swimming and diving finals are set for noon on Saturday. You can watch the action live online at www.prepspotlight.tv. Here are some photos from today's send off!

The SPHS Entrepreneurship class, taught by Mr. Schoenborn, is selling Saints Stickers as part of a class project. The navy blue fleur-de-lis, trimmed in white, come in two sizes and are perfect for your vehicle, water bottle, devices, and other personal belongings. The big stickers are $5 and the smaller stickers are $2.

To order or for more information you can contact the class via email at fleur_de_cals@outlook.com or through Instagram at fleur_de_cals. Students can also purchase them in the SPHS commons area during Saints time starting on Wednesday (Nov. 13).

post_text: North Elementary wrapped up today's Veterans Day recognition events with a program at the end of the school day. The event featured 1991 SPHS alum Heather Gordon, who served most of her service time in Guam for the US Navy as a photojournalist, as the guest speaker. She presented a slide show of some her work as a military photographer and talked about her experiences in the Navy, which positively impacted her life. Several other veterans in attendance were also recognized during the program. Here are some photo highlights.

SPHS VETERANS DAY: A full house was on hand for the Saint Peter High School's Veterans Day program, held Monday morning at the Performing Arts Center. Mark Roemhildt, a 1987 SPHS grad and Commander, US Navy (retired), was this year's guest speaker. Also participating were the SPHS Concert Choir and Concert Band.

The event is put on each year by the SPHS Social Studies department. A welcome reception for veterans was also held in the school's Community Room prior to the event, with coffee and donuts provided. Here are some photo highlights from today's recognition event at SPHS. Photos from the Middle School and North Elementary will be shared later today!

post_text:
Saint Peter High School ninth graders have been spending time recently doing a community service project as part of their Individual Determinations lessons, which took place during the recently-completed first quarter. Each of the 10 homerooms are now taking turns volunteering at Minneopa State Park to help Scott Kudelka, Minnesota DNR Minneopa Area Naturalist, cut and clear brush at the park.

Kudelka first took each homeroom out on a walk at the park to learn a little about the prairie, what to cut/what not to cut, before the students went to work! Afterwards each homeroom is taken on a tour of the park to see and learn about the bison.

Thanks to Amanda Rodning for sharing this photos of some of her homeroom students during their visit to Minneopa Park today.

SECTION 1A SWIMMING & DIVING MEET INFO: Best of luck to the SPHS swimmers and divers as they travel to Rochester starting tomorrow (Wednesday) for the Section 1A meet. The following is a breakdown of the three days of competition:

* Swimming prelims get underway at noon on Wednesday, Nov. 6, at the Rochester Recreation Center (21 Elton Hills Dr NW, Rochester, MN).

* Diving prelims, semifinals, and finals get underway at noon on Thursday, Nov. 7, at Rochester John Marshall High School (1510 14th St NW, Rochester, MN ).

* Swimming finals starts at noon on Friday, Nov. 8, at the Rochester Recreation Center.

Admission to the Section 1A Swimming & Diving Meet is $8 for adults and $5 for students for each day. #STPNation #RollSaints

FFA NATIONAL CONVENTION UPDATE: Saint Peter High School FFA members were busy today (Wednesday) in Indianapolis, according to co-advisor Michael Reeser. The local contingent started the day off with radio interviews, which can be heard on KNUJ and KCHK or check ther website to hear play backs if you missed it live. Just look for South Central Agri-science Academy.

Next up Michael Moline and Olivia Stevens are shown preparing to go across stage in front of 30,000 members to receive our National Chapter 3 Star Award, which is the highest award given by the National FFA organization and recognizes chapters for their work in their home, school, and communities. Stay tuned for more updates as they are made available!

MARCHING BAND INDOOR CONCERT: A reminder that the 34th annual Saint Peter High School Indoor Marching Band Concert will take place at 7:30 p.m. tomorrow (Friday, Nov. 1) in the SPHS Performing Arts Center. This event is free and open to the public, and there will also be a silent auction starting at 6:30 p.m., which will conclude at intermission.

According to David Haugh, SPHS’s band director, this year’s theme is video game music, and will again feature small and large ensembles, as well as the color guard and jazz band before the full band comes on in the second half. Led by drum majors Matthew Springer and Haydon Grams, as well as Haugh and student teacher, Rachael Rhoades, the Saints are looking forward to performing for you!

post_text:
NATIONAL FFA CONVENTION UPDATE: A group of Saint Peter High School agri-science/FFA students are in Indianapolis this week for the 92nd annual National FFA Convention. As the SPHS contingent was making its way down to Indianapolis earlier this week, they made a stop at Precision Planting, a company in Morton, Ill., to tour that facility.

Precision Planting designs and manufactures precision planting technology allowing farms to more than double their planting speed to 10 mph with the use of 20/20 computer system and speed tube. The system can also monitor soil temperature, planting depth, and soil moisture to make on the go changes to allow for more accurate planting and improved profits for farmers.

Here are some photo highlights from that tour that Michael Reeser, SPHS FFA co-advisor, was kind enough to share. More info/details on the rest of the National FFA Convention trip will be shared as they become available!

SECTION 2AA VOLLEYBALL: Congrats to the Saints on their big 3-0 win over Tri-City United last night (Tuesday) in the Section 2AA, South Sub-Section semifinal round.

The win sets up a Highway 169 showdown at 6 p.m. tomorrow (Thursday) in New Prague with the #1-seed Saints battling #2-seed Le Sueur-Henderson in the South Sub-Section title match. The Giants edged the Saints 3-1 in the opening match of the season back on August 22. Admission is $7 for adults and $5 for students and tickets are available for purchase at the door.

The Saints/Giants winner advances to the Section 2AA championship at 7:45 p.m. on Saturday at Mankato East against either Southwest Christian or Belle Plaine. Those two teams meet in the second match tomorrow night at New Prague. #STPNation #BumpSetAdvance

post_text:
AMERICAN INDIAN PARENT ADVISORY COMMITTEE: Minnesota Statutes, section 124D.78, requires that all Minnesota districts and tribal schools with 10 or more American Indian students have an American Indian Parent Advisory Committee (AIPAC). These committees serve in an advisory role to their school/district and help ensure that American Indian students are receiving culturally relevant and equitable educational opportunities. They are critical to the achievement and success of American Indian students statewide.

Saint Peter’s Advisory Committee has been in place for two years and is looking to expand its membership!

Items the council is working on:
* Advising content teachers in meeting academic standards specific to Native history/culture
* Advisory for district equity work

Our next meeting will be held at the Saint Peter Middle School Media Center on Wednesday, Oct. 23 from 5:30 to 6:30 p.m.

Feel free to bring your kids!

If interested in joining the committee, please contact Jon Graff, SPMS principal, at jgraff@stpeterschools.org.

post_text:
SECTION 2A GIRLS SOCCER: Best of luck to #2-seed Saints girls soccer team as they host #3-seed Fairmont at 7 p.m. tomorrow (Tuesday) at Floyd B. Johnson Field in Section 2A Tourney semifinal round. The Saints (12-3-1 overall) edged Mankato East 1-0 on Saturday advance to the semifinal round, while the Cardinals (13-2-1) beat Holy Family Catholic 2-1 in overtime. This will be the third time the Saints and Cards have met with Saint Peter winning two hard-fought games (1-0 and 2-1) earlier this season. The winner advances to the Section 2AA championship on Thursday at 5 p.m. against either #8 New Ulm or #4 Waconia, who also play tomorrow in the other semifinal game.

Admission for tomorrow night's Saints/Cards game is $8 for adults and $5 for students, and remember that SPHS activities passes are not accepted for admission.
